info.title: Box
info.description: The Box Content API gives you access to secure content management and content experience features for use in your own app. It strives to be RESTful and is organized around the main resources you???re familiar with from the Box web interface.

options.description: The Pre-flight check API will verify that a file will be accepted by Box before you send all the bytes over the wire.

get.summary: Get File's Info, Get Embed Link
get.description: Used to retrieve the metadata about a file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

put.summary: Update File Info, Lock and Unlock, Create Shared Link
put.description:
Used to update individual or multiple fields in the file object, including renaming the file, changing its description, and creating a shared link for the file. To move a file, change the ID of its parent folder. An optional If-Match header can be included to prevent race conditions.

To lock and unlock files, you execute a PUT operation on the /files/{file id} endpoint and set or clear the lock properties on the file.

Used to create a shared link for this particular file. Please see here for m

parameters.name: If
parameters.description: The etag of the file can be included as an ???If-Match??? header to prevent race conditions.

delete.description: Discards a file to the trash. The etag of the file can be included as an ???If-Match??? header to prevent race conditions.

parameters.name: If
parameters.description: The etag of the file can be included as an ???If-Match??? header to prevent race conditions.

post.description: Restores an item that has been moved to the trash. Default behavior is to restore the item to the folder it was in before it was moved to the trash. If that parent folder no longer exists or if there is now an item with the same name in that parent folder, the new parent folder and/or new name will need to be included in the request.

get.description: Retrieves the actual data of the file. An optional version parameter can be set to download a previous version of the file.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: The range value in bytes. Format should be bytes={start_range}-{end_range}

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The ID specific version of this file to download.

parameters.name: BoxApi
parameters.description: The shared link for this item. Format should be shared_link=SHARED_LINK

get.description: If there are previous versions of this file, this method can be used to retrieve information about the older versions. (Versions are only tracked for Box users with premium accounts.)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

post.description: If there are previous versions of this file, this method can be used to promote one of the older versions to the top of the stack. This actually mints a copy of the old version and puts it on the top of the versions stack. The file will have the exact same contents, the same SHA1/etag, and the same name as the original. Other properties such as comments do not get updated to their former values.

delete.description: Discards a specific file version to the trash. (Depending on the enterprise settings for this user, the item will either be actually deleted from Box or moved to the trash.)

parameters.name: If
parameters.description: The etag of the file can be included as an ???If-Match??? header to prevent race conditions.

post.description: Used to create a copy of a file in another folder. The original version of the file will not be altered.

get.description: Retrieves a thumbnail, or smaller image representation, of this file. Sizes of 32x32,64x64, 128x128, and 256x256 can be returned in the .png format and sizes of 32x32, 94x94, 160x160, and 320x320 can be returned in the .jpg format. Thumbnails can be generated for the image and video file formats listed here.

parameters.name: EXTENSION
parameters.description: The preview format, e.g. png or jpg

parameters.name: min_height
parameters.description: The minimum height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: min_width
parameters.description: The minimum width of the thumbnail

parameters.name: max_height
parameters.description: The maximum height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: max_width
parameters.description: The maximum width of the thumbnail

get.description: Retrieves an item that has been moved to the trash.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an item that is in the trash. The item will no longer exist in Box. This action cannot be undone.

get.description: Retrieves the comments on a particular file, if any exist.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

get.description: Use this to get a list of all the collaborations on a file

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

get.description: Retrieves all of the tasks for given file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

post.description: Used to create a new empty folder. The new folder will be created inside of the specified parent folder

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

get.description: Retrieves the full metadata about a folder, including information about when it was last updated as well as the files and folders contained in it. The root folder of a Box account is always represented by the id ???0???.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

put.summary: Update Folder, Create Shared Link, Create or Delete
put.description:
Used to update information about the folder. To move a folder, update the ID of its parent. To enable an email address that can be used to upload files to this folder, update the folder_upload_email attribute. An optional If-Match header can be included to ensure that client only updates the folder if it knows about the latest version.

Used to create a shared link for this particular folder. Please see here for more information on the permissions available for shared links. In order to get defa

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: If
parameters.description: The etag of the file can be included as an ???If-Match??? header to prevent race conditions.

delete.description: Used to delete a folder. A recursive parameter must be included in order to delete folders that have items inside of them. An optional If-Match header can be included to ensure that client only deletes the folder if it knows about the latest version.

parameters.name: If
parameters.description: The etag of the file can be included as an ???If-Match??? header to prevent race conditions.

post.description: Restores an item that has been moved to the trash. Default behavior is to restore the item to the folder it was in before it was moved to the trash. If that parent folder no longer exists or if there is now an item with the same name in that parent folder, the new parent folder and/or new name will need to be included in the request.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

get.description: Retrieves the files and/or folders contained within this folder without any other metadata about the folder. Any attribute in the full files or folders objects can be passed in with the fields parameter to get specific attributes, and only those specific attributes back; otherwise, the mini format is returned for each item by default. Multiple attributes can be passed in separated by commas e.g. fields=name,created_at. Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and offset parameters.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

post.description: Used to create a copy of a folder in another folder. The original version of the folder will not be altered.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

get.description: Use this to get a list of all the collaborations on a folder i.e. all of the users that have access to that folder.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

get.description: Retrieves an folder that has been moved to the trash.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an folder that is in the trash. The item will no longer exist in Box. This action cannot be undone.

get.description: Retrieves the files and/or folders that have been moved to the trash. Any attribute in the full files or folders objects can be passed in with the fields parameter to get specific attributes, and only those specific attributes back; otherwise, the mini format is returned for each item by default. Multiple attributes can be passed in separated by commas e.g. fields=name,created_at. Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and offset parameters.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

get.description: Used to retrieve the watermark for a corresponding Box file.

put.description: Used to apply or update the watermark for a corresponding Box file. The endpoint accepts a JSON body describing the watermark to apply.

delete.description: Used to remove the watermark for a corresponding Box file.

get.description: Used to retrieve the watermark for a corresponding Box folder.

put.description: Used to apply or update the watermark for a corresponding Box folder. The endpoints accepts a JSON body describing the watermark to apply.

delete.description: Used to remove the watermark for a corresponding Box Folder.

post.description: Creates a web link object within a given folder.

get.description: Use to get information about the web link.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

put.description: Updates information for a web link.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

delete.description: Deletes a web link and moves it to the trash

post.description: Used to create a new metadata template with the specified schema.

get.description: Used to retrieve all metadata templates within a user's enterprise. Currently only the enterprise scope is supported.
Used to retrieve the schema for a given metadata template.

put.description: Used to update the schema of an existing template.

get.description: Used to retrieve all metadata associated with a given file

post.description: Used to create the metadata template instance for a corresponding Box file. When creating metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted.

get.description: Used to retrieve the metadata template instance for a corresponding Box file.

put.description:
Used to update the template instance. The request body must follow the JSON-Patch specification, which is represented as a JSON array of operation objects (see examples for more details). Updates can be either add, replace, remove , test, move, or copy. The template instance can only be updated if the template instance already exists. When editing metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted.
The update is applied atomically. If any errors occur during the a

delete.description: Used to delete the template instance. To delete custom key:value pairs within a template instance, you should refer to the updating metadata section.

get.description: Used to retrieve all metadata associated with a given folder

post.description: Used to create the metadata template instance for a corresponding Box folder. When creating metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted.

get.description: Used to retrieve the metadata template instance for a corresponding Box folder.

put.description: Used to update the template instance. Updates can be either add, replace, remove , or test. The template instance can only be updated if the template instance already exists. When editing metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted.

delete.description: Used to delete the template instance. To delete custom key:value pairs within a template instance, you should refer to the updating metadata section.

get.description: Used to retrieve all pending collaboration invites for this user.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Must be 'pending'

post.description: Used to add a collaboration for a single user or a single group to a folder. Either an email address, a user ID, or a group id can be used to create the collaboration. If the collaboration is being created with a group, access to this endpoint is granted based on the group's invitability_level.

get.description: Used to get information about a single collaboration. All collaborations for a single folder can be retrieved through GET /folders/{id}/collaborations. A complete list of the user???s pending collaborations can also be retrieved.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Must be 'pending'

put.description: Used to edit an existing collaboration. Descriptions of the various roles can be found here.

delete.description: Used to delete a single collaboration.

get.description: The search endpoint provides a powerful way of finding items that are accessible by a single user or an entire enterprise. Leverage the parameters listed below to generate targeted advanced searches.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The string to search for; can be matched against item names, descriptions, text content of a file, and other fields of the different item types.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope for which you want to limit your search to. Can be user_content for a search limited to only the current user or enterprise_content for the entire enterprise. To enable the enterprise_content scope for an administrator, please contact us.

parameters.name: file_extensions
parameters.description: Limit searches to specific file extensions like pdf,png,doc. Requires one or a set of comma delimited file extensions: file_extension_1,file_extension_2,....

parameters.name: created_at_range
parameters.description: The date for when the item was created. Specify the date range by using RFC3339 timestamp variables separated by a comma: from_date,to_date (e.g 2014-05-15T13:35:01-07:00,2014-05-17T13:35:01-07:00). Trailing from_date, and leading ,to_date commas are also accepted, where the current date and earliest known date will be designated respectively.

parameters.name: updated_at_range
parameters.description: The date for when the item was last updated. Specify the date range by using RFC3339 variables separated by a comma: from_date,to_date(e.g 2014-05-15T13:35:01-07:00,2014-05-17T13:35:01-07:00). Trailing from_date, and leading ,to_date commas are also accepted, where the current date and earliest known date will be designated respectively.

parameters.name: size_range
parameters.description: Filter by a file size range. Specify the file size range in bytes separated by a comma:lower_bound_size,upper_bound_size, where 1MB is equivalent to 1000000 bytes. Trailing lower_bound_size, and leading ,upper_bound_size commas are also accepted as parameters.

parameters.name: owner_user_ids
parameters.description: Search by item owners. Requires one or a set of comma delimited user_ids: user_id_1,user_id_2,...

parameters.name: ancestor_folder_ids
parameters.description: Limit searches to specific parent folders. Requires one or a set of comma delimited folder_ids: folder_id_1,folder_id_2,.... Parent folder results will also include items within subfolders.

parameters.name: content_types
parameters.description: Limit searches to specific Box designated content types. Can be name, description, file_content, comments, or tags. Requires one or a set of comma delimited content_types: content_type_1,content_type_2,....

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type you want to return in your search. Can be file, folder, or web_link.

parameters.name: trash_content
parameters.description: Allows you to search within the trash. Can be trashed_only or non_trashed_only. Searches without this parameter default to non_trashed_only.

parameters.name: mdfilters
parameters.description: Filters for a specific metadata template for files with metadata object associations. The filters are to be placed in a single JSON object. Please refer the MDFilters object in the definitions section of the swagger.json

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

get.description:
Shared items are any files or folders that are represented by a shared link. Shared items are different from other API resources in that a shared resource doesn???t necessarily have to be in the account of the user accessing it. The actual shared link itself is used along with a normal access token.
Used to retrieve the metadata about a shared item when only given a shared link. Because of varying permission for shared links, a password may be required to retrieve the shared item. Once the item

parameters.name: BoxApi
parameters.description: The shared link for this item. Format should be shared_link=SHARED_LINK

get.description: Retrieves the collections for the given user. Currently, only the favorites collection is supported.

Retrieves the files and/or folders contained within this collection. Collection item lists behave a lot like getting a folder???s items.
Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and offset parameters.
Sub-object fields can be requested via the ?fields parameter

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

post.description: Used to add a comment by the user to a specific file or comment (i.e. as a reply comment).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

get.description: Used to retrieve the message and metadata about a specific comment. Information about the user who created the comment is also included.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

put.description: Used to update the message of the comment.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a comment.

post.description: Used to create a single task for single user on a single file.

get.description: Fetches a specific task.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a specific task.

get.description: Retrieves all of the assignments for a given task.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

post.description: Used to assign a task to a single user. There can be multiple assignments on a given task.

get.description: Fetches a specific task assignment.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

put.description: Used to update a task assignment.

delete.description: Deletes a specific task assignment.

get.description:
Use this to get events for a given user. A chunk of event objects is returned for the user based on the parameters passed in. Parameters indicating how many chunks are left as well as the next stream_position are also returned.

To retrieve Enterprise Events specify 'stream_type=admin_logs'. Retrieves up to a year' events for all users in an enterprise. Upper and lower bounds as well as filters can be applied to the results.

parameters.name: stream_position
parameters.description: The location in the event stream at which you want to start receiving events. Can specify special case ???now??? to get 0 events and the latest stream position for initialization.

parameters.name: stream_type
parameters.description: Limits the type of events returned: all: returns everything, changes: returns tree changes, sync: returns tree changes only for sync folders

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of events to filter by

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: A lower bound on the timestamp of the events returned

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: An upper bound on the timestamp of the events returned

options.description: To get real-time notification of activity in a Box account, use the long poll feature of the /events API. To do so, first call the /events API with an OPTIONS call to retrieve the long poll URL to use. Next, make a GET request to the provided URL to begin listening for events. If an event occurs within an account you are monitoring, you will receive a response with the value new_change. It???s important to note that this response will not come with any other details, but should serve as a prompt

post.description: Used to provision a new user in an enterprise. This method only works for enterprise admins.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

get.description: Returns a list of all users for the Enterprise along with their user_id, public_name, and login.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

parameters.name: filter_term
parameters.description: A string used to filter the results to only users starting with the filter_term in either the name or the login.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

parameters.name: user_type
parameters.description: The type of user to search for. Valid values are all, external or managed.  If nothing is provided, the default behavior will be managed only

get.description: Retrieves information about the user who is currently logged in i.e. the user for whom this auth token was generated.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

get.description: Retrieves information about a user in the enterprise. Requires enterprise administration authorization.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

put.description:
Used to edit the settings and information about a user. This method only works for enterprise admins. To roll a user out of the enterprise (and convert them to a standalone free user), update the special enterprise attribute to be null.

Used to convert one of the user???s confirmed email aliases into the user???s primary login.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

delete.description: Deletes a user in an enterprise account.

put.description: Moves all of the owned content from within one user???s folder into a new folder in another user???s account. You can move folders across users as long as the you have administrative permissions and the ???source??? user owns the folders. To move everything from the root folder, use ???0??? which always represents the root folder of a Box account.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

get.description: Retrieves all email aliases for this user. The collection of email aliases does not include the primary login for the user; use GET /users/USER_ID to retrieve the login email address.

post.description: Adds a new email alias to the given user???s account.

delete.description: Removes an email alias from a user.

post.description: Invites an existing user to join an Enterprise. The existing user can not be part of another Enterprise and must already have a Box account. Once invited, the user will receive an email and prompt to accept the invitation within the Box web application. This method requires the "Manage An Enterprise" scope for the enterprise, which can be enabled within your developer console.

get.description: Gets all the device pins within a given enterprise. Must be an enterprise admin with the manage enterprise scope to make this call.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: Needs not be passed or can be empty for first invocation of the API. Use the one returned in response for each subsequent call.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Default is "asc". Valid values are asc, desc. Case in-sensitive, ASC/DESC works just fine.

get.description: Gets information about an individual device pin.

delete.description: Delete individual device pin.

post.description: Used to create a new retention policy.

get.description: Retrieves all of the retention policies for the given enterprise.

parameters.name: policy_name
parameters.description: A name to filter the retention policies by. A trailing partial match search is performed.

parameters.name: policy_type
parameters.description: A policy type to filter the retention policies by.

parameters.name: created_by_user_id
parameters.description: A user id to filter the retention policies by.

get.description: Used to retrieve information about a retention policy

put.description: Used to update a retention policy.

get.description: Returns a list of all retention policy assignments associated with a specified retention policy.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type you want to return in your search. Can be file, folder, or web_link.

post.description: Returns a list of all retention policy assignments associated with a specified retention policy.

get.description: Used to retrieve information about a retention policy assignment.
Retrieves all file version retentions for the given enterprise.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: A file id to filter the file version retentions by.

parameters.name: file_version_id
parameters.description: A file version id to filter the file version retentions by.

parameters.name: policy_id
parameters.description: A policy id to filter the file version retentions by.

parameters.name: disposition_action
parameters.description: The disposition action of the retention policy. This action can be permanently_delete, which will cause the content retained by the policy to be permanently deleted, or remove_retention, which will lift the retention policy from the content, allowing it to be deleted by users, once the retention policy time period has passed.

parameters.name: disposition_before
parameters.description: See content times for formatting

parameters.name: disposition_after
parameters.description: See content times for formatting

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: Needs not be passed or can be empty for first invocation of the API. Use the one returned in response for each subsequent call.

post.description: Create a new Legal Hold Policy. Optional date filter may be passed. If Policy has a date filter, any Custodian assignments will apply only to file versions created or uploaded inside of the date range.

parameters.description: A name to filter the retention policies by. A trailing partial match search is performed.

delete.description: Sends request to delete an existing Legal Hold Policy. Note that this is an asynchronous process - the Policy will not be fully deleted yet when the response comes back.

post.summary: Create New Legal Hold Policy Assignment
post.description: Create a new Assignment, which will apply the Legal Hold Policy to the target of the Assignment.

get.description: Get details of a single assignment.

delete.description: Sends request to delete an existing Assignment. Note that this is an asynchronous process - the Assignment will not be fully deleted yet when the response comes back.

get.summary: Get List of File Version Legal Holds
get.description: Get list of non-deleted Holds for a single Policy.

parameters.name: policy_id
parameters.description: A policy id to filter the file version retentions by.

get.description: Get details of a single File Version Legal Hold.

post.description: Create Webhook

get.description:
Returns all defined webhooks for the requesting application and user, up to the limit. If no limit is supplied then Box uses the default limit of 100.
If more than limit webhooks are defined then Box returns the webhooks in batches. When the results are batched, Box sends limit webhooks along with a next_marker field in the response object. The value of the next_marker field is a marker string that you can use in later requests to tell Box which batch to send next.
When you send a request that i

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: Needs not be passed or can be empty for first invocation of the API. Use the one returned in response for each subsequent call.

get.description: Get a Webhook

delete.description: Permanently deletes a webhook
